overview_summary: None of these five neighboring landowners have a documented stance for or against development, as no public statements or actions could be found. Most appear to be low-profile residents with no formal community roles; one was a local business owner but is now deceased. Influence in the community is limited across the group, with all but one rated low and no high-influence neighbors identified.

neighbors.name: Michael C. Brunn
neighbors.claims: Michael C. Brunn is listed as an owner of property in the Town of Cobleskill, Schoharie County, but has no evident public profile or civic roles ([www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov](https://www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov/EdocWebApp/faces/VillCob/index.xhtml#:~:text=Schoharie%20County%20Government%20Public%20Documents,this%20page%20are%20documents%20grouped)). No meeting minutes or local news references were found that indicate Brunn’s participation in community or development issues ([www.theschoharienews.com](https://www.theschoharienews.com/2015/07/#:~:text=Written%20By%20Michael%20on%207%2F19%2F15,the%20moratorium%20through%20the%20remainder)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a local liaison reach out one-on-one to Mr. Brunn in a neighborly manner, focusing on building rapport and listening to any concerns or questions.

neighbors.name: Sarah E. Ferns
neighbors.claims: Sarah E. Ferns appears as a Cobleskill landowner in county records, with no public information on any community positions ([www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov](https://www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov/EdocWebApp/faces/VillCob/index.xhtml#:~:text=Schoharie%20County%20Government%20Public%20Documents,this%20page%20are%20documents%20grouped)). Her name does not surface in local news or meeting archives, suggesting no notable involvement in development debates ([www.theschoharienews.com](https://www.theschoharienews.com/2015/01/#:~:text=January%202015%20,Silver%20Allegations%20May%20Lead%20to)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Ms. Ferns through a personal, friendly conversation (e.g., a door-to-door visit) to introduce the project and understand her perspective, since no pre-existing positions are known.

neighbors.name: William Ward
neighbors.claims: William D. Ward Jr. (born 1957) was a lifelong Schoharie County resident and the owner of W.D.W. Trucking, LLC based in Cobleskill ([www.merenessputnamfuneralhome.com](https://www.merenessputnamfuneralhome.com/obituaries/william-ward-jr#:~:text=Carlisle,which%20he%20operated%20several%20years)) ([www.merenessputnamfuneralhome.com](https://www.merenessputnamfuneralhome.com/obituaries/william-ward-jr#:~:text=School,race%20cars%20and%20most%20recently)). He passed away in December 2022 at age 65, and there is no record of him having taken a public stance on local development or energy projects ([www.merenessputnamfuneralhome.com](https://www.merenessputnamfuneralhome.com/obituaries/william-ward-jr#:~:text=April%205%2C%201957%20%E2%80%94%20December,4%2C%202022)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with Mr. Ward’s family or estate executor in a respectful manner. Emphasize understanding their plans for the property and explain how the project could align with the family’s interests now that Mr. Ward is deceased.

neighbors.name: Thomas J. Barbarie
neighbors.claims: Thomas J. Barbarie is identified as a Cobleskill property owner, though he maintains a low profile with no public community positions ([www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov](https://www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov/EdocWebApp/faces/VillCob/index.xhtml#:~:text=Schoharie%20County%20Government%20Public%20Documents,this%20page%20are%20documents%20grouped)). No evidence could be found of Barbarie speaking at meetings or in the media about development or energy issues ([www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com](https://www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com/index.asp?type=Social#:~:text=Cobleskill%20Times,Air%20Street%20Movies%20which%20ran)).

approach_recommendations.engage: If possible, have a mutual acquaintance or respected community member introduce the project to Mr. Barbarie to establish trust. Given his low public profile, a personal approach focused on friendly dialogue is recommended.

neighbors.name: Luis Torres
neighbors.claims: Luis Torres appears on the tax rolls as a landowner in Cobleskill, but he has no known involvement in local organizations or government ([www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov](https://www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov/EdocWebApp/faces/VillCob/index.xhtml#:~:text=Schoharie%20County%20Government%20Public%20Documents,this%20page%20are%20documents%20grouped)). There are no mentions of Torres in local news or public records concerning development or clean energy projects ([www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com](https://www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com/index.asp?type=Social#:~:text=County%20www.cobleskilltimesjournal.com%20%20...bring%20tears,dozen%20Cobleskill%20Police%20Department%20officers)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Mr. Torres with a straightforward, informative meeting or call to introduce the project. Since he has no recorded community ties or stance, providing clear information and inviting questions will help engage him.
